newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: NZ share market ends stronger on hefty volume.
newsitem.headline: NZ share market ends stronger on hefty volume.

text.p: * NZ share rises on good demand, encouraged by Wall Street
* Telecom strong, and market picked to stay firm
* Sky City rises after well received result
The New Zealand share market closed stronger on hefty volume on Wednesday and brokers said it was in good shapre for a further rise.
"We had a good solid day," said Hendry Hay McIntosh broker Tim Koller, adding that expects demand to continue on Thursday.
The strong finish on Wall Street and the U.S. resumption from the long weekend encouraged demand in the leaders, particularly Telecom and the Fletcher stocks.
The top 40 index closed 14.65 ahead at 2,237.73 on volume of $71 million.
Telecom closed five up at $6.98 and earlier was bid up to $7.00, while Fletcher Paper was up three at $2.82.
There was heavy turnover in Fletcher Building which ended seven cents stronger at $3.32.
Brierley Investments was steady on $1.43 a day ahead of its result which is generally expected to be a $320 million net profit for the year.
Several of the second line stocks peformed strongly.

Sky City gained 19 cents to $7.11 a day after its result, which was in line with forecasts. Brokers said the company appeared to have taken some one-off costs while profits from its casino slot machines were forecast to do well.

Energy Direct was also up 19 to to $3.19, possibly the beneficiary of a decision by national grid operator Trans Power to charge South Island generators the costs of power transmission across the Cook Strait.
Fisher & Paykel was another middle stock to run well, ending 15 cents up at $5.00.
